intro: Delphinium dzavakhischwilii, commonly known as the Dzavakhishvili delphinium, is a species native to the Caucasus region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant features showy, blue to purple spires of tubular flowers, which are characteristic of the delphinium genus. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, with some foliage along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a striking addition to alpine gardens.
